CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 28, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "PICKET CIVIC ARENA - Supporters of the Pittsburgh NAACP and the Negro-American Labor Council gathered outside the Civic Arena to protest hiring policies at the new amphitheatre, Saturday. The group, which included many local citizens active in 'fight for rights,' picketed and sand several choruses of 'Nearer, My God, to Thee.' - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Three men, and two women, protesting in front of Civic Arena with signs reading, "Let's All Have A Fair Share, Jobs"
